Job Title: Revenue & Compensation Accountant

Location: Linthicum Heights, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
At Anne Arundel Dermatology we give exceptional care - to our patients and to each other.
Patient First | Caring | Accountability | Trust | One Team | Growth
Founded 50+ years ago with a mission to provide the highest quality and full spectrum of medical, surgical, and esthetic skin care services to each and every one of its patients, Anne Arundel Dermatology has assembled the finest group of dermatologists in the Mid-Atlantic and Southeastern states. With 250+ clinicians and 110+ locations in 7 states, we’re thriving, growing, and looking to add talented individuals to our team!
Why join Anne Arundel Dermatology?We are committed to continual training and education for our physicians and staff. We are on top of the latest developments in dermatology including ongoing research, emerging treatments, new medications and prevention methods. You can find more than just a job with Anne Arundel Dermatology. We believe in providing our new associates with intensive hands on training and long-term career growth opportunities from within.
As the Revenue & Compensation Accountant, you will assume a pivotal role in the effective management of the key financial aspects within our organization. Your primary responsibilities include performing the calculation of Provider (physicians/advanced practioners) compensation, prepare Provider compensation statements, respond to Provider inquiries, ensuring accurate recording of revenue-related transactions and related accounting records. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, utilizing financial systems, and contributing to the preparation of comprehensive financial reports will be integral to your role. This position presents a unique opportunity for impactful contributions to our financial processes, supporting the organization in achieving its financial goals.
Schedule: Hours will flexible be between 8am-6pm. This position is hybrid but will require 1-2 days on-site. 
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)Dental insuranceEmployee discountFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insurance
Responsibilities:Perform Provider compensation calculations, tracking various structures and agreements to ensure compliance.Oversee revenue-related transactions and ensure accurate recording in financial systems.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather financial data and contribute to the preparation of comprehensive financial reports.Reconcile compensation accruals on a monthly basis.Conduct regular audits of financial transactions to maintain accuracy and integrity.Provide support in financial analysis and forecasting to contribute to strategic decision-making.Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and best practices to ensure compliance and optimal financial management.Collaborate with internal and external auditors during financial audits.Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.Proficient in financial software and Microsoft Office Suite.Effective communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.Knowledge of relevant financial regulations and compliance.
Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or relevant professional certification is preferred.Minimum two (2) years’ experience in public accounting or similarPhysical Requirements:Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

Experience Level (if available): None
